definition: Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: Late Baroque towns of the Val di Noto, Italy.
sentences.chinese: 意大利诺托谷的晚期巴罗克风格城镇。

sentences.english: Furniture of the baroque period can be recognized by its ornate carvings.
sentences.chinese: 巴罗克时期的家具以豪华的雕刻作为鉴别标志。

sentences.english: The baroque age brought a new interest in instrumental music.
sentences.chinese: 在巴罗克时期，人们重新对器乐产生了兴趣。

sentences.english: The building retains the baroque style.
sentences.chinese: 这建筑保持了巴罗克风格。

sentences.english: Such decoration was a typical feature of the baroque period.
sentences.chinese: 这种装饰是巴罗克时期的特征。

sentences.english: The typical characteristic of Baroque music is replacing the old with the new.
sentences.chinese: 巴罗克音乐的典型特征是去旧图新。

definition: Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
Logue or Rogge (name)/Jacques Rogge, president of International Olympic Committee (IOC)
